contentList.content: Battle is a dance where you move among foes with style and grace, landing powerful finishing moves with a flick of the wrist and a flash of your blade.
You boast, taunt, and psychologically needle your foes.
You move carefully, feinting and creating false openings to lead your foes into inopportune attacks.
You reposition, maneuver, and bewilder your foes with daring feats of physical prowess.
You aren’t afraid to use underhanded tactics to get the edge over your opponents.
You are friendly, clever, and full of humor, always knowing just what to say. Your witticisms leave foes unprepared for the skill and speed of your attacks.
You Stride up to your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">speed</LSTag>. During this movement, you can try to move through the space of one enemy.
Can pass through an enemy's space with a successful acrobatics check.
Attempt to pass through an enemy's space, making an acrobatics roll against the enemy's acrobatics DC.
Powerful finisher actions can be used only while you have panache and cause you to lose your panache.
You Stride up to your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">speed</LSTag>. During this movement, you can try to move through the space of one enemy.
You gain an elegant finishing attack you can make when you have <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
You make an incredibly graceful attack, piercing your foe’s defenses. Make a Strike which deals half your precise strike damage on failure.

When you make a Strike with an agile or finesse melee weapon or agile or finesse unarmed attack, you deal [1] additional precision damage. If the Strike is part of a finisher, the additional damage is [2] precision damage instead.
As your swashbuckler level increases, so does your additional damage for precise strike.
This move can only be used when you have panache, and consumes your panache on use.

You gain the tumble through action, which has the bravado trait. Stride, and you can try to pass through one enemy's space with an Acrobatics check. This action can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.

You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to bravado skill checks. While you have <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>, your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement speed</LSTag> increases by [1].
You can take advantage of an opening from your enemy's fumbled attack. You either make a melee Strike against the triggering enemy or attempt to Disarm it of the weapon it used for the Strike.

When an enemy critically fails a strike against you, you attempt to Disarm it of the weapon it used for the Strike. This is a bravado skill and can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.

When an enemy critically fails a strike against you, you make a melee Strike against the triggering enemy. This is a bravado skill and can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.

When you’ve made an impression, you move even faster than normal, darting about the battlefield with incredible speed. Increase the status bonus to your Speed from stylish combatant to [1]; this bonus increases by a further [2] at 7th, and 11th levels.
When you don’t have panache, you still get half this status bonus to your Speed, rounded down to the nearest [2] increment.
You perform swashbuckling techniques with exceptional flair, making them harder to resist. Your circumstance bonus from Stylish Combatant increases to +2
You have a dramatic flair about you in any situation. Your circumstance bonus from Stylish Combatant applies to all checks made with Acrobatics and the trained skill from your swashbuckler's style.
+1 circumstance bonus to bravado skill checks
+2 circumstance bonus to bravado skill checks
+2 circumstance bonus to bravado skill checks
When you hit a foe with your finisher, if the foe was temporarily immune to your Demoralize, their temporary immunity ends.
When you hit a foe with your finisher they become off-guard until your next turn.
When you hit a foe with your finisher you gain a damage bonus to the roll equal to the number of die rolled if the foe was grabbed, restrained, or prone.
When you hit a foe with your finisher they suffer a 10 foot penalty to their speed until the end of their next turn.
When you hit a foe with your finisher they take a –2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls against you until the end of their next turn.

You execute your finishing moves with spectacular flair, adding special effects to your finishers. If a Strike you make as part of a finisher hits a foe, if the foe was temporarily immune to your Demoralize, their temporary immunity ends.
You execute your finishing moves with spectacular flair, adding special effects to your finishers. If a Strike you make as part of a finisher hits a foe they become off-guard until your next turn.

You execute your finishing moves with spectacular flair, adding special effects to your finishers. If a Strike you make as part of a finisher hits a foe you apply your Precise Strike bonus damage twice.

You execute your finishing moves with spectacular flair, adding special effects to your finishers. If a Strike you make as part of a finisher hits a foe they suffer a 10 foot penalty to their speed until the end of their next turn.

You execute your finishing moves with spectacular flair, adding special effects to your finishers. If a Strike you make as part of a finisher hits a foe they take a –2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls against you until the end of their next turn.
On failure, you step as a free action.
You make an incredibly graceful attack, piercing your foe’s defenses. Make a Strike which deals half your precise strike damage on failure.
You make a calculated attack without letting down your guard. Make a melee Strike, and on a failure, you Step as a free action.
You make a calculated attack without letting down your guard. Make a melee Strike, and on a failure, you Step as a free action.

You attack with a flashy assault that leaves your target off balance. Make a melee Strike. If you hit the target is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="OFF_BALANCED">off-guard</LSTag> until the end of your next turn.

You attack with a flashy assault that leaves your target off balance. Make a melee Strike. If you hit the target is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="OFF_BALANCED">off-guard</LSTag> until the end of your next turn.

You stab two foes with a single thrust or bash them together with one punch. Make a melee Strike against up to two foes in a line. An Impaling Finisher counts as two attacks when calculating your multiple attack penalty.

You stab two foes with a single thrust or bash them together with one punch. Make a bludgeoning or piercing melee Strike against up to two foes in a line. An Impaling Finisher counts as two attacks when calculating your multiple attack penalty.
Your blow inflicts profuse bleeding. Make a slashing or piercing Strike. If you hit, the target also takes persistent bleed damage equal to your precise strike finisher damage.

You split your attacks. Make two melee Strikes, one with each hand, each against a different foe. If the second Strike is made with a non-agile weapon, it takes a –2 penalty. Increase your multiple attack penalty only after attempting both Strikes.
Your blow inflicts profuse bleeding. Make a Strike. If you hit, the target also takes persistent bleed damage equal to your precise strike finisher damage.

You split your attacks. Make two melee Strikes, one with each required weapon, each against a different foe. If the second Strike is made with a non-agile weapon, it takes a –2 penalty. Increase your multiple attack penalty only after attempting both Strikes.

You attempt a dizzying blow. Make a melee Strike. If you hit, your foe must attempt a Fortitude save with the incapacitation trait against your class DC, applying <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STUNNED1">stunned 1</LSTag> on a failure, and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STUNNED3">stunned 3</LSTag> on a critical failure. On a success, the target cannot take reactions until its next turn.

Your foe must attempt a Fortitude save with the incapacitation trait against your class DC, applying stunned 1 on a failure, and stunned 3 on a critical failure. On a success, the target cannot take reactions until its next turn.

You attempt a dizzying blow. Make a melee Strike. If you hit, your foe must attempt a Fortitude save with the incapacitation trait against your class DC, applying stunned 1 on a failure, and stunned 3 on a critical failure. On a success, the target cannot take reactions until its next turn.
Your excellent display of fighting prowess leaves your opponent stumbling back. Make a Strike. If you hit, the target is pushed [2] back (or [1] on a critical hit).
Your excellent display of fighting prowess leaves your opponent stumbling back. Make a Strike. If you hit, the target is pushed 5 feet back (or 10 feet on a critical hit).

Your attack harms and hinders your foe. Choose to target the foes arm, leg, or head, and Strike. If you hit the target, you apply an effect corresponding to the chosen body part. This hindrance lasts until the end of their next turn. On a critical hit, you also apply a lesser effect lasting for 1 minute.
The target is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TARGETING_FIN_ENFEEBLED_2">enfeebled 2</LSTag>. On a critical hit, it is also <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ENFEEBLED_1">enfeebled 1</LSTag> for 1 minute.
The target is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TARGETING_FIN_STUPEFIED_2">stupefied 2</LSTag>. On a critical hit, it is also <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="Stupefied1">stupefied 1</LSTag> for 1 minute.
The target takes a [1] status penalty to its Speeds. On a critical hit, it also takes a [2] status penalty to its Speeds for 1 minute.

Your attack harms and hinders your foe. Choose to target the foes arm, leg, or head, and Strike. If you hit the target, you apply an effect corresponding to the chosen body part. This hindrance lasts until the end of their next turn. On a critical hit, you also apply a lesser effect lasting for 1 minute.
You attack in motion. Stride and then Strike.
You attack in motion. Strike as a free action after your stride.
Cannot be the target of Dual Finisher's Second Attack

Make a second melee Strike with the weapon in your off hand against a different foe. If the second Strike is made with a non-agile weapon, it takes a –2 penalty. Increase your multiple attack penalty only after attempting both Strikes.
Sacrifice your dual finisher second strike
Battle is a dance where you move among foes with style and grace. Dart between combatants with flair and land powerful finishing moves with a flick of the wrist and a flash of the blade.
You boast, taunt, and psychologically needle your foes.
You move carefully, feinting and creating false openings to lead your foes into inopportune attacks.
You aren’t afraid to use underhanded tactics to get the edge over your opponents.
You reposition, maneuver, and bewilder your foes with daring feats of physical prowess.
You are friendly, clever, and full of humor, always knowing just what to say. Your witticisms leave foes unprepared for the skill and speed of your attacks.
Retaliate with a strike when a creature critically misses you with a melee attack. This action can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.

You care as much about the way you accomplish something as whether you actually accomplish it in the first place. When you perform an action with particular style, you can leverage this moment of verve to perform spectacular, deadly maneuvers. This heightened state of flair is called panache.
Feint has the bravado trait for you and can be used to gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
Demoralize has the bravado trait for you and can be used to gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.

With a sudden shout, a well-timed taunt, or a cutting put-down, you can shake an enemy's resolve. Choose a creature within 30 feet of you who you're aware of. Attempt an Intimidation check against that target's Will DC. Regardless of your result, the target is temporarily immune to your attempts to Demoralize it for 10 minutes. This action can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.

With a misleading flourish, you leave an opponent unprepared for your real attack. Attempt a Deception check against your target's Perception DC. This action can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
You can try to pass through one enemy's space with an Acrobatics check.
You Stride up to your Speed. During this movement, you can try to pass through one enemy's space with an Acrobatics check. This action can grant you panache.
You can try to pass through one enemy's space with an Acrobatics check. This action can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
You try to knock an item out of a creature's grasp. Attempt an Athletics check against the target's Acrobatics DC. This action can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
You try to knock an item out of a creature's grasp. Attempt an Athletics check against the target's Reflex DC. This action can grant you panache.
You knock weapons from the hands of your foes with style. Disarm has the bravado trait for you and can be used to gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
While you have a shield raised, if a creature critically misses you with a Strike, you gain panache until the end of your next turn.

You use one-handed weapons to parry with style. You must have a one-handed melee weapon equipped. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, or a +2 circumstance bonus if you have a free hand.
If a creature misses you with a Strike while you have this bonus, you gain panache until the end of your next turn.

You use one-handed weapons to parry with style. You must have a one-handed melee weapon equipped. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, or a +2 circumstance bonus if you have a free hand. If a creature misses you with a Strike while you have this bonus, you gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag> until the end of your next turn.
You allow your foes to make the first move in a show of incredible confidence. You may chose to go last in combat, but begin combat with <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
You go last in combat, but begin combat with <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.

You deftly dodge out of the way of a strike you can see, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the strike misses, you gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag> until the end of your next turn.

You deftly dodge out of the way of a strike you can see, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If the strike misses, you gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag> until the end of your next turn.
-1 status penalty to all attacks and DCs until it makes a strike against the source.

When danger calls, you have a strange knack for coming out on top. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the triggering save. If you succeed on the triggering saving throw, you gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag> until the end of your next turn.

When danger calls, you have a strange knack for coming out on top. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the triggering save. If you succeed on the triggering saving throw, you gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag> until the end of your next turn.
Finishing a foe maintains your swagger. You gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag> whenever your finisher brings a target to 0 HP.
Your tumbling puts your foes on the back foot. When you Tumble Through successfully, the foe you Tumbled Through is off-guard against the next attack you make before the end of your turn.

You use your weapon to deflect an attack against your ally, granting a +2 circumstance bonus to their AC against the triggering attack, which must turn the triggering hit into a miss. You gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag> until the end of your next turn.

You use your weapon to deflect an attack against your ally, granting a +2 circumstance bonus to their AC against the triggering attack, which must turn the triggering hit into a miss. You gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag> until the end of your next turn.
Even when your foe avoids your Confident Finisher, you can still hit a vital spot. On a failure with Confident Finisher, you apply your full precise strike damage instead of half.

When you compound panache with even more derring-do, it somehow tends to work out. If you already have <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>, you can roll twice and use the higher result on bravado skill checks.
At the start of each of your turns when you regain your actions, you gain an additional reaction that can be used only to perform an <LSTag Tooltip="OpportuneRiposte">Opportune Riposte</LSTag>.
You can riposte almost without a thought. At the start of each of your turns when you regain your actions, you gain an additional reaction that can be used only to perform an Opportune Riposte.
You already have Tumble Through active.
Handles forced movement animation of tumble through
You can try to pass through one enemy's space with an Acrobatics check. This action can grant you panache.
Demoralize has the bravado trait for you, and can grant you panache.
Feint has the bravado trait for you, and can grant you panache.
Clear the negative status effect from Bon Mot.

You launch an insightful quip at a foe, distracting them. Choose a foe within 30 feet and roll a Diplomacy check against the target's Perception DC. This action can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
The target is distracted and takes a –2 status penalty to Perception and Will saves for 1 minute. The target can end the effect early with a retort to your Bon Mot.
The target is distracted and takes a –3 status penalty to Perception and Will saves for 1 minute. The target can end the effect early with a retort to your Bon Mot.
The target is clumsy 1 until they use an Interact action to end the impediment

You hook a foe's bootlaces together, pull their hat over their eyes, loosen their belt, or otherwise confound their mobility through an underhanded tactic. Attempt a Thievery check against the target's Acrobatics DC. This action can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
Clear the negative status effect from Dirty Trick.
You gain the Bon Mot action. It has the bravado trait for you and can be used to gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
You gain the Dirty Trick action. It has the bravado trait for you and can be used to gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
You attack in motion. Stride and then Strike.
You must have spent at least 1 action to stride before using this action.
Shove has the bravado trait for you, and can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
Grapple has the bravado trait for you, and can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
Trip has the bravado trait for you, and can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
Shove has the bravado trait for you, and can grant you panache.
Grapple has the bravado trait for you, and can grant you panache.
Trip has the bravado trait for you, and can grant you panache.
You push a creature away from you with a successful Athletics check against your target's Athletics DC. This action can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.

Attempt an Athletics check to grapple your target, preventing it from moving and making it <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="OFF_BALANCED">off-guard</LSTag>. This action can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
Attempt an Athletics check to trip your target, knocking it <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">prone</LSTag>. This action can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
Minus 2 Circumsatance penalty to attacks against the source of this status.
You can give the target a -2 circumstance penalty to their next attack against you instead of the usual effect.
You can give the target a -2 circumstance penalty attacks against you until the end of their next turn.
Your easily maneuver against your foes. Your Disarm, Grapple, Shove, and Trip actions have a lower multiple attack penalty.
You shine brightest in desperate moments. Once per short rest, at the start of your turn you gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag> until the end of your turn.
Once per short rest, at the start of your turn you may gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag> until the end of your turn.
Once per short rest, at the start of your turn you may gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag> until the end of your turn.
It is not the start of your turn.
You dash past an opponent, confounding them with underhanded tactics. Stride up to your speed. You can attempt a Trip or a Dirty Trick (if you have that action) against one opponent within range.
You dash past an opponent, confounding them with underhanded tactics. Stride up to your speed. You can attempt a Trip or a Dirty Trick (if you have that action) against one opponent within range.
Attempt an Athletics check to trip your target, knocking it <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">prone</LSTag>.
You combine a series of attacks with a powerful finishing blow. Your finishers' Strikes have a lower multiple attack penalty.
You try to knock an item out of a creature's grasp. This action can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.

Your tricks make foes overextend their attacks. When you roll a success with a feint, you can choose to give your target a circumstance penalty on attack rolls against you instead of the usual effects.
Aided by a Swashbuckler's One for All ability.
Make a Diplomacy check to aid the chosen Ally

With precisely the right words of encouragement, you bolster an ally's efforts. Designate an ally within 30 feet; this action counts as sufficient preparation to Aid that ally. When you use the Aid reaction to help that ally, you can roll Diplomacy and the action can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.

With precisely the right words of encouragement, you bolster an ally's efforts. Designate an ally within 30 feet; this action counts as sufficient preparation to Aid that ally. When you use the Aid reaction to help that ally, you can roll Diplomacy and you may gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.

Your taunts and threats earn your foes' ire. When you successfully Demoralize a creature, its frightened condition can't decrease to less than 1 at the end of its turn until it either uses a hostile action against you
Must be a different target to the first strike.
Removes the mark on the first target of Dual Finisher

Somehow you always escape the reaper by a hair's breadth. Once per long rest, you avoid being knocked out or killed, remain at 1 Hit Point, and gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
Once per long rest, you avoid being knocked out or killed, remain at 1 Hit Point, and gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
You can use Flashy Dodge when attempting a Reflex save, in addition to its original trigger. If you do, the circumstance bonus applies to your Reflex save against the triggering effect.
Use Flashy Dodge when attempting a Reflex save, in addition to its original trigger. If you do, the circumstance bonus applies to your Reflex save against the triggering effect.

You capitalize on an opponent's failure with smug attitude and swagger, reminding them of the gap in skill between you and your opponent. You attempt to Demoralize an opponent that failed a roll against you since your last turn.
You may attempt a free Demoralize against this opponent at the start of your next turn.
You may attempt a free Demoralize against a disappointed opponent at the start of your next turn.
Target must have missed a strike against you.

Your ego swells, granting you a temporary reprieve from your pain. If you gained <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag> this turn, you may gain temporary Hit Points equal to your level plus your Charisma modifier ([1]) that last until the start of your next turn.
If you gained <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag> this turn, you may gain [1] temporary Hit Points that last until the start of your next turn.
You may gain temporary Hit Points equal to your level plus your Charisma modifier that last until the start of your next turn.
Temporary Hit Points equal to your level plus your Charisma modifier that last until the start of your next turn.
Your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag> will only last until this status expires.
The target has a -2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls against you.
Applies panache to avoid race conditions
Minus 2 Circumsatance penalty to the next attack against the source of this status.
Minus 2 Circumsatance penalty to the next attack against the source of this status.
-1 status penalty to all attacks and DCs until you make a strike against the source.

Your taunts and threats earn your foes' ire. When you successfully Demoralize a creature, its frightened condition can't decrease to less than 1 at the end of its turn until it either uses a hostile action against you
You combine a series of attacks with a powerful finishing blow. Your finishers' Strikes have a lower multiple attack penalty.
Suffers [1] damage at the end of each turn, until making a DC 15 flat check.
Must be wielding a one-handed melee weapon.
Must not be wielding a one-handed melee weapon.
Uses an exploit where 0 duration polymorph statuses fail to clear animation sets to change the tumble through falling animation
You try to pass through one enemy's space with an Acrobatics check against their Reflex DC. This action can grant you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PANACHE">panache</LSTag>.
Contains functors for successful tumble through.
Contains functors for unuccessful tumble through.
Contains functors for unuccessful tumble through.
Tumble Through uses a contested skill check. This passive is given to the target to manipulate the result.
Sets the rolled value to 10 for calcualting contested DCs.
